Tim McGraw and Faith Hill Farm in Tennessee

Tim McGraw and Faith Hill’s farm in Franklin, Tennessee is listed for $20 million. Tim McGraw and Faith Hill have a combined net worth of $135 million rated No. 10 on The Richest Celebrity Couples list. Their combined music success list is record-breaking with their tour Soul2Soul II Tour being the highest-grossing country tour of all time.

The farm has four different homes on the property and sits on 753 acres with property details boasting “rolling pastures, ponds, spring fed creeks, and a 12 stall barn with a caretakers apartment.

One of the four residences is a restored log home. The real estate details say “the Antebellum home needs restoration.” Antebellum in architecture refers to a time and place in history or “before war” like elegant plantation homes built in the south before the civil war. In this case, I assume it refers to the main house listed as built in 1850.

Restoration or not, the sprawling farm seems like something to keep, but up for sale it is, so we get a look at southern farm living, celebrity style.

~Welcome to the Tim McGraw and Faith Hill Farm

The restored log cabin. I wonder how far apart the four homes on the 753 acres are from each other?

Black and white checked kitchen fireplace with black pots and pans hanging above it reminiscent of days gone by.

The 12 stall barn with caretakers quarters.

Looks like McGraw and Hill have cleared out and are not living here with no furniture in the large living area or entrance. As presented, it’s more country-casual than I expected.

Looking around at real estate in Franklin, Tennessee reveals quite a few big ole plantation style homes for sale in the double-digit millions I need to explore further.

For more information and photos visit the real estate agent’s website Steve Fredrich of Fridrich & Clark Realty.

Source: Celebrity Net Worth 2012 and Fridrich & Clark Realty.

Thank you so much for making Housekaboodle part of your day.
